subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






April 16, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESAt Least 31 Killed In Va. Tech Massacre
Gunfire erupted in a dorm and classroom at Virginia Tech, killing at least 31 people and wounding at least 20 others, authorities
                        said. The suspected gunman used two handguns in the shootings and took his own life, CBS News reports. More...Watch: Gunshots Heard On Campus
• Flooded Homes, Power Outages On East Coast
                     					| Watch• Al-Sadr Loyalists Quit Iraqi Cabinet• German Army Video Shows Racist Bronx Jeer
                     					| WatchU.S.Padilla Judge Limits 9/11 References 
A federal judge ruled that prosecutors can make only narrow references to the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks and cannot suggest
                        that alleged al Qaeda operative Jose Padilla and two co-defendants were involved. More...
• University Of Texas Tower Sniper Recalled• At Least 31 Killed In Va. Tech Massacre
                     					| Watch• Flooded Homes, Power Outages On East Coast
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldAl-Sadr Loyalists Quit Iraqi Cabinet
Six Iraqi Cabinet members loyal to the radical cleric Muqtada al-Sadr resigned today, to protest the Iraqi leadership's refusal
                        to set a timetable for the withdrawal of American forces. Meanwhile, 2 U.S. soldiers were killed in Baghdad. More...
• France Knew Of Hijack Plot Before 9/11• German Army Video Shows Racist Bronx Jeer
                     					| Watch• World Bank Chief On The Ropes
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsBush Presses Democrats On Iraq Bill
President Bush accused congressional Democrats of putting U.S. troops in the middle of the policy debate over funding for
                        the Iraq war. He again called on Congress to send him a bill that does not set a withdrawal deadline. More...Watch: War Fund Delay 'Unacceptable'
• Pure Horserace: A Few Fundraising Truths
                     					| Watch• Hillary Banks Big Bucks For Primary• More Post-Crash Surgery For N.J. Governor• More StoriesHealthThe Curse Of The Night Owl
A new study indicates they have a tougher time getting through the day than others who lack sleep. Dr. Philip Muskin
                        explained why and discussed possible remedies on The Early Show. More...Watch: A Night Owl's Nightmare
• Autism: More Treatable Than Thought?
                     					| Watch• How Safe Is Imported Food?• No More Diets!
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechAfghans Fear Phones Spread Deadly Virus
Health officials in Afghanistan blamed the Taliban for circulating a rumor that warned cell phones users against answering
                        calls from "strange numbers" that would cause blood to pour from their nose and ears, because of a deadly virus. More...
• NASA: Mars Probe Doomed By Human Error• China Steps Up Online Porn Busts• Google To Buy DoubleClick For $3.1B Cash• More StoriesBusinessFrom Pro Football To Harvard Yard
NFL players swap their pads for laptops in the off-season, taking classes at Harvard Business School to prepare for life after
                        football. Wharton, Northwestern's Kellogg, and Stanford offer similar programs. More...
• Don't Fritter Away Your Tax Refund• Student Loan Provider Sallie Mae Sold• Dreaded Middle-Class Tax May Be Fixed• More StoriesEntertainmentNude Photos Of Kate Moss To Be Auctioned
Nude photographs of Kate Moss will be sold at an auction in London next month among a series of other pictures of the British
                        supermodel. More...
• Madonna And Child Visit Village In Malawi
                     					| Watch• Regis Says He'll Return To TV April 26• Split With Prince "Devastated" Middleton
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionU.S. Military Dangerously Small
The wars in Iraq and Afghanistan have pushed U.S. troops to the breaking point, largely because the military is smaller than
                        it was a few decades ago. National Review Online warns that without bulking up the military, the U.S. is at dire risk. More...Watch: Troops To Stay Longer
• Oversight Is Torture For Bush• Muddy Waters Still Run Deep For Gonzales• Andy's Trip To The Auto Show
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Celeb Spot: Split With Prince "Devastated" Middleton
Prince William and longtime girlfriend Kate Middleton have called it quits and rumors abound about why. But royal watcher
                        Katie Nicholl says that Middleton can stand on her own two feet, even though she is very upset by the breakup. More...Watch: Royal Romance Ends
• ShowBuzz: People In Hot Water: Spector Words May Hurt Him In Murder Trial

Gunshots Heard On CampusCBS News RAW: A gunman opened fire on the Virginia Tech campus, killing at least 31 people and wounding many more.
                                    Student Jamal Albarghouti captured the sound of gunshots on his cell phone.
